result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale A Laughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Carrie Couillard, Jesse Honaker or Keelan Gilbertson.
May apply for expungement, if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
AMENDED 6-7-16:  Judge grants 35 days sentence credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Amend JOC - 35 days sentence credit
Defendant's Motion for Sentence Credit.  Sent to DA's office.
Printed in error.  No changes made.  JMM

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Stichert.   Defense waived the reading of the amended information.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1 in the amended information.  Remaining charges are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of amended count 1.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation, concurrent.   AODA, and recommended treatment.      Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Obtain and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation, concurrent each case.  AODA, and recommended treatment.      Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Subject to random drug testing.   Obtain and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation.  No contact with Carrie Coulliard, Jesse Honaker, Keelan Gilbertson.   CC,  including DNA surcharge.  Attorney Stichert  made a motion to withdraw a attorney of record.  Granted.
